title: Sauteed Broccoli Rabe and Peas.
summary: Sauteed Broccoli Rabe and Peas. might be just the side dish you are searching for. This recipe serves 6 and costs 71 cents per serving. One portion of this dish contains approximately 5g of protein, 9g of fat, and a total of 134 calories. Not a lot of people made this recipe, and 1 would say it hit the spot. If you have olive oil, broccoli rabe, peas, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. It is a good option if you're following a caveman, gluten free, primal, and vegan diet. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes roughly 20 minutes. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 87%. This score is spectacular. Try Sauteed Broccoli Rabe, Sauteed Broccoli Rabe, and Sauteed Broccoli Rabe for similar recipes.
instructions: Preparation                                                        Trim stem ends from broccoli rabe and discard. Cut remainder crosswise into  1 1/2-inch pieces.                                                                Cook broccoli rabe and peas in a 4- to 6-quart pot of boiling salted water until broccoli rabe is wilted and stems are crisp-tender, 2 to 3 minutes. Drain well in a colander.                                                                Heat oil with garlic in a 12-inch heavy skillet over moderately high heat, turning garlic frequently, until garlic is golden, 1 to 2 minutes, then discard garlic.                                                                Add broccoli rabe, peas, salt, and pepper to skillet and sauté, stirring, until well coated with garlic oil, about 2 minutes.

steps.step: Trim stem ends from broccoli rabe and discard.
Cook broccoli rabe and peas in a 4- to 6-quart pot of boiling salted water until broccoli rabe is wilted and stems are crisp-tender, 2 to 3 minutes.
Heat oil with garlic in a 12-inch heavy skillet over moderately high heat, turning garlic frequently, until garlic is golden, 1 to 2 minutes, then discard garlic.
Add broccoli rabe, peas, salt, and pepper to skillet and sauté, stirring, until well coated with garlic oil, about 2 minutes.
